I'd recommend the 3 selection dinner box for 14 dollars. It is the best price for for the amount of food you get. Be aware that you can sample any of the food on the line!!  Just ask!  The place is very clean and has three options for dining.  You can eat outside, inside in a more cafeteria type setting, or in the more formal restaurant area.  There is more wine and beer here than you can possible imagine!  You can even buy single bottles of beer to have with your dinner if you choose.  The coffee is fantastic and the wine is even better.  Don't forget to grab some deserts when your done eating.   Oh, they also have a large shopping area filled with kitchen items and food preparation supplies.  My fav part is their olive bar!  It rivals Harris Teeter!   Stop in for the best experience you can hope for with food!!  Cheers!
What a nice place. wish there was a bit of better explanation of what to do but it tasted wonderful. A bit pricey but I could tell that when I walked in. I really enjoyed the food though

So this place is super fancy. And get ready to shell out the $$$ for the average meal or drink. But having said that, I had the greatest experience here. New in town, I stopped in here with a book one sweltering summer's day, and flipped through my pages over a delicious glass of sweet tea. When I was ready to leave, I asked for the check, put away my book, opened the little black cheque holder, and found a little note saying 'Have a nice day! :)'. It made my night.

Bought cheese, breads, and Pate, and Apple Turnover!! Gosh, this place is awesome!! the cheese were awesome!! Bread, fresh and piping hot! Pate, Gah!!! So Yummy!! and the Apple Turnover was delicious ( It tasted like apple pie, but it has bit of cinnamon which remind me of christmas) so it and happy day for me!!

What a treat this location is. I know I have reviewed the downtown location, with only 3 stars, Phillips Place definitely outdoes it. With the food, bakery, and wine selection this store is a true gem. I wandered the aisles to check things out and decided to hit the food bar and ordered the chicken wrap, which was so delicious! And pretty big, I was definitely full! I also love the new wine bar and outside seating area, and I look forward to going back on a nice afternoon early evening.

They oft times have hard to get ingredients, at a huge price premium.  Coffee tastes like hot dishwater.  They let go Regina, the cheese/charcuterie lady and killed the meat and fish department.  Shot Gary from the wine property/restaurant across the street. Not a whole lotta reason to go anymore but they can sponsor a shitty golf tournament.

Bartenders are really friendly, helpful and know their wines. Food is really good too, with a changing seasonal menu. Don't be afraid to ask for suggestions, the staff is excellent as suggesting new things to try. My favorite neighborhood stop.
The selection of wine is both tasteful and extensive. I only had a small Asian salad however it was one of the best I have ever had everything was fresh crisp and delicious.

The Dean & Deluca wine room never fails to deliver some of the very best food in Charlotte. No pretense, just really great quality food with a creative flair, and good spirited and attentive service. And they recently added valet parking making a visit to Phillips Place on a Fri or Saturday night seamless.

Review of Sandwich/Salad area* I'm usually a D&D fan but this place is flat out not good. Went earlier this year, the sandwich/salad area wasn't very clean and the food quality was poor, which is shocking for a D&D. Went back with my wife on Saturday because we thought they may have just been having a bad day the first time. Sadly, this experience was so bad that a review was warranted. The two sandwich guys were rude/weird, the prep station was filthy, the food in the bins looked old/empty, and the sandwiches we ordered were getting slapped together haphazardly in a very messy fashion. When we saw the rind was left on the slices of brie going on the sandwich we simply walked out, leaving the other items we had planned on purchasing on the counter.

What a great concept.  I love places like this.  A swanky grocery store that has great food with quality ingredients.  It's basically a shop where you can order from the deli, and they have ginormous amounts of salads and other things you can sample and then buy by the pound. I went and had an empanada, a small sushi box, and some spaghetti squash.  Oh man, the squash was so smooth.  The workers behind the counters were friendly, and maybe it was complete luck, but the girl scooped exactly .25 lb of the squash into the bowl (I guess including the weight of the bowl) but still, i was fairly impressed. They also have a ton of great drinks like Saranac cream soda, dr roberts, izze, etc.  It is kinda expensive, but it's good food, so it's worth a splurge now and then.

Overly expensive  OK, we live overseas so many of the foodstuffs at this place are not that exotic to us.    In any case, it does look like a nice selection of deli meats and cheeses.  Three of us had two apps and several glasses of wine apiece.  Bill came to $150.  Fairly scandalous in my view.  Wine prices even higher than Paris or London.  And your view is a surface parking lot and not the Seine.   Macarons $4 apiece.  They only cost 2 in Paris and 1 in the rest of the country.  Anyway, if I lived here I doubt I'd hang here much.  There must be a lot better value for the $$$ at other wine bars.

There's something about Phillip's Place that reminds me of my beloved home in California.  The outdoor style, old towne construction and lo and behold, a Dean and Deluca!  I love Dean and Deluca.  It's a foodie's paradise packed into a small, navigable shop.  You have your ready-to-eat/deli, your barista, your bakery,  your confectionery, your butcher, cheese etc. all in one place.  The best part: the staff are knowledgeable and friendly, plus you get to taste samples.  I used to turn my nose up at ready-made dips or sauces, but this place has some great ones.  Try the Bread and Butter Pickle Jalapeno Dip by Fiesta - mix that with some cream cheese and you've got one tasty dip!  Make sure you don't accidentally buy the overly spicy Texas Longhorn brand.  Their Roasted Red Pepper and Onion dip is delicious too.    If you're looking for a hard to find vinegar, oil or seasoning - chances are, you'll find them at Dean and Deluca (albeit at a slightly higher price point).  I like buying bread there and on my way out, I grab a Chai latte - they make the best!

My husband and I visited this establishment today. For the record, we have visited Dean & Deluca's on numerous occasions. We wanted to grab an appetizer and a drink before heading over to take in a movie, so we went to the bar. The facility is very clean and the ambiance is great. We sat at the bar, because we knew we were not going to be there long. The server helped us with our drinks and seemed to be very cordial. I ordered a Red Wine and my Husband ordered Moscato. Which were great choices for us both. Our appetizer was calamari and it was cooked to perfection. Why the 1 star? Well, while leaving, the server brought the cook out to the bar area, and they were speaking unprofessionally about their Patrons...Us! I don't know why, because We ALWAYS leave a 20% tip wherever we dine, and are never mean to the staff, for fear of them spitting in our food. My husband wanted to confront them, but I said it wasn't worth it. Dean and Deluca's, please hire more professional staff. Your staff is representing you, and it wasn't a good look   at all Sunday August 20th 2017 at 1:15 pm.

I honestly can't believe that anyone would give this place a 4 or (gasp!) 5 star rating! I work in NYC where wine bars are a dime a dozen and I have the luxury of checking many of them out so my expectations are admittedly high. However, there is no excuse for such poor service. This is not my first trip here...it's my 3rd and service is consistently POOR. Arrived mid day on a Sunday to meet 2 friends. Bar was empty sans a handful of people. Bartender was inattentive to start and had to flag her down each and every time. Almost appeared to be an inconvenience for her to wait on us. We ordered several small bites to share including the French cheese plate. When she dropped the plates off without a word we called her back and asked her to explain what cheeses were which. She clearly did not know and then proceeded to identify the cheeses (using the menu!) for the European cheese plate. Ummm....wrong cheese plate! She never checked back to see how our food was and after we asked twice for the check she literally "dropped" it on the bar in front if us.   Now regarding the food...cheese plate small and disappointing...bread wasn't worth the chew. White bean dip was great and so was the gazpacho.  I'll be back to D&D but not to the wine room!

First time here and never knew it was a market ! The place is clean, beautifully stocked with amazing colors and signs, and easy to move around. The place can be a bit confusing for newbies with understanding how and where to order, pay, etc. If you are new and in a rush this may not be the place for you only because figuring out the menu and their offerings can take a minute, but it's all good once you get the hang of it. There is plenty of patio seating for a beautiful day. The customer service is great, they really know their stuff and they will help you with whatever you need. And of course the food is amazing.

I stopped by here not too long before closing, so I didn't get to check out all of the specialty items they have for sale, but I will definitely be back. I went straight for the sweet baked goodies. This trip I bought two of their 4" mini cakes. I wish a vanilla option was available. I chose the lemon and chocolate cakes.   This was my first time at the South Park location and it didn't disappoint. I walked past the food buffet on my way to the register, tempted to stop and take a closer look but I was on a snack mission. I wouldn't let anything deter me. I will be back earlier to buy more of their high priced offerings.
